snippet: Former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif was projected to be the big winner in Saturday’s election, which was marred by violence and reports of fraud at the polls.
abstract: Former Pakistani Prime Min Nawaz Sharif begins talks to form new government, as partial election returns suggest that he and his party will have commanding hold on Parliament; election officials say final results will take days, even as outrage grows over accusations of rampant vote-rigging.

byline.contributor: Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud contributed reporting from Islamabad, and Zia ur-Rehman from Karachi, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif was projected to be the big winner in Saturday’s election, which was marred by violence and reports of fraud at the polls.

headline.seo: Nawaz Sharif Starts Talks on Forming Government in Pakistan
headline.main: Pakistani Party Leader Looks Forward, as Claims of Vote-Rigging Swirl
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Party Leader Looks Forward, as Claims of Vote-Rigging Swirl
